   - What year did you start housekeeping in eastern Canada? (213)

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Canada? Approximately how many people attended at that time?

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on our own or on locally produced foods? Give details.

We relied on our garden chickens, pork & lard to get through the winter. We had enough to eat, but had to work hard to get these things which kept our growing family of four boys & one girl healthy.

Our first means of transportation was a good team of oxen & mule. We worked in summer, fall, or course we got horses & buggy & we had plenty for horses in those days & we still go to the farm in summer one son John Ernest - patch on the wheel & kept a few head of stock & has a full line of modern machinery.

18. Did you ever have to almost starve? Give details.

We relied on our garden, chickens, hens & ducks.

We always had enough to eat, but had to work for
to get these things which kept our growing
family of four boys & one girl healthy.

Our first means of transportation was a good team of oxen
& sleds loaded with wood & supplies in summer. Later we used a
horse & buggy & are proud of having our horses in those days & we still
go to the farm in summer one son John Ernest - faithful on the
wondering horse until a few years ago when he has a full line of modern machinery.
